intro: Curcuma vinhlinhensis, commonly known as the Vinh Linh turmeric, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange-yellow rhizomes, which contain bioactive compounds similar to those found in common turmeric. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that grow in a rosette pattern. The flowering stems produce fragrant, yellowish-orange flowers, making it a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
